results.definition: a statement that is assumed to be true and from which a conclusion can be drawn
examples: on the assumption that he has been injured we can infer that he will not to play

results.definition: set forth beforehand, often as an explanation
examples: He premised these remarks so that his readers might understand

results.definition: furnish with a preface or introduction
examples: She always precedes her lectures with a joke
He prefaced his lecture with a critical remark about the institution

results.definition: take something as preexisting and given
